solution_line_template: First, we need to determine the price per contact in each of the two choices. We begin by performing {contacts_box_a}/{cost_box_a}= <<{contacts_box_a}/{cost_box_a}={contacts_per_dollar_a}>>{contacts_per_dollar_a} contacts per every dollar spent on choice A.

Next, we determine the price per contact of the alternate choice. We do this by performing {contacts_box_b}/{cost_box_b}= <<{contacts_box_b}/{cost_box_b}={contacts_per_dollar_b}>>{contacts_per_dollar_b} contacts for every dollar spent on choice B.
